Posts.Content: Jun 30, 2009 01:41PM anniese wrote: Hi Diane, I had DD chemo also.  Started with A/C four times then finished with 4 Taxol (all DD).  I was very happy to be put on this schedule as I wanted to zap those cancer cells as much as I could.  I know that I would have felt better between infusions if I'd had the extra week to recouperate but at the time my main focus was on getting rid of the cancer.  By the time I got to the 4th A/C infusion I was getting pretty weary but now, looking back, I am very glad that I was given this schedule.  I had the neulasta shot every time I had the A/C infusion and took the clariton the day of the shot and for 2 days after.  I had a little bit of the bone pain side effect but nothing intolerable.  I didn't need the neulasta shots during taxol as my white cell counts were okay.  I finished my tx in a little over 3 months - if I hadn't had done this on a dose dense schedule it would have been almost 5 months till I finished.  I hope this helps.
Posts.Title: Dose Dense Chemo stef58 anniese

Posts.Content: Jul 1, 2009 10:37AM anniese wrote: Hi Dianne, I drank tons of water also which I think makes a big difference in both nauseau and mouth sores - I didn't end up with any mouth sores (took good care with brushing my teeth and used the baking soda/salt mixture for tooth paste).  I worked part time throughout my entire chemo schedule and was just careful to wash my hands frequently and not touch my face unless I had recently washed or used some antibacterial hand sanitizer (have one on my desk, became my best friend).  I did, however, get sick right before my second infusion - my daughter came home with a cold and gave it to me.  It was a pretty bad cold but they went ahead with my infusion even though I was sick.  I did end up on antibiotics after about 10 days because it moved into my chest.  Good news is the antibiotics took care of it very quickly.  After finishing the A/C and switching to Taxol I did very well - the Taxol was much easier on me, no nauseau and my appetite came back and food started smelling good again (I think part of that could have been the steroids they give you with Taxol).  Gained about 5 pounds and then started getting heartburn regularly - so, they told me to take Zantac every afternoon.  As far as when you know whether it's working - I was at about the week before my 4th DD A/C when I started noticing the lump in my breast was decreasing in size and that I could no longer find the lump in my armpit.  The onc checked me and said it appeared to be shrinking but would not commit to that.  Didn't find out for sure that it worked for me until after surgery when they told me I had NED from pathology.
Posts.Title: Dose Dense Chemo stef58 anniese

Posts.Content: Feb 9, 2012 02:33PM anniese wrote: So sorry you have to go through this again.  My thoughts and prayers are with you.

Posts.Content: Jul 6, 2009 03:56PM anniese wrote: Stef58 - just a side note - if you do try the baking soda and salt I believe the mixture was 2 parts baking soda to 1 part salt.......
Posts.Title: Dose Dense Chemo stef58 anniese

Posts.Content: May 22, 2008 04:37PM anniese wrote: Hi everyone - I too have surgery in June on the 4th.  Only two weeks from now.  I finished dose dense chemo on May 2nd.  I have to follow surgery with radiation so am not getting reconstruction now, have to wait for 6 to 12 months for that.  I'm second guessing myself all over the place.....am scheduled for a mastectomy and SNB.  Had an option of a lumpectomy, but the amount of tissue they will have to remove is above the recommended amount for a lumpectomy (over 1/3 as the original tumor was 5.5 cm).  Could have opted for an expander for the 6 to 12 months I have to wait for reconstruction, but didn't want to take the chance (30 to 50% chance) of having expander failure and having to go back into surgery to have it removed during radiation - thus delaying the radiation.  Anxiety has started to creep in.....  Thanks for reading, I know I haven't posted much (although I have read MUCH) here.  Can't imagine what it will be like to wake up after surgery and know that part of me is gone.
Posts.Title: Surgery in June? carollyn Kymberlyn
